comments.author: SmartGold01
comments.body: There are lots of ideas over here especially at the beginners and Helps section you would see them, then back to your question.. is either you buy bitcoin from exchange or from p2p over some users here who do provide such services and the next you need is to download an electrum wallet it's more safer and preferably to use. You don't have to store your bitcoin in any exchange site because you don't have full control of your coin, after purchasing from exchange that is more friendly to your country moved them out, and before that make sure to pass kyc to avoid drama while your coin is inside the exchange. But if you cares about privacy I will advise to buy from p2p where you have to pay with other altcoin then you will receive BTC to your electrum wallet.

comments.author: Mrbluntzy
comments.body: OP, befor you Invest into bitcoin, the final decision is likely to be taken by you and not any body else. You know how much you have in your account and how much you are earning as salary, so you should know how much you can afford to invest. investing on bitcoin requires you to have a very good ability to hold your bitcoin without regarding the volatile nature of bitcoin. If you are not sure to hold for a long time, then only invest what you can hold for the time you are willing to sell. Bitcoin Investment is long term Investment and if you are Investing into bitcoin now, you should make the decision of Holding it till the Bull run Start before or after bitcoin halving have occure in 2024.

I would've love to give you the answer from my knowledge but it's not too necessary so I will only quote so advice or decoded ways to buy bitcoin from some members here. Quote from: JayJuanGee on December 15, 2021, 02:10:03 AM Once BTC accumulation targets are either established or at least there is some directional appreciation that you have to accumulate some bitcoin, then the next strategy would be to consider how to go about BTC accumulation.  Surely, the best three ways to consider BTC accumulation is through 1) dollar cost averaging (DCA), 2) lump sum investing and 3) buying on dips.  The consideration of these three strategies is also best in the order that I presented them.  DCA has the advantage of having a kind of regular flow into your BTC investment that can really add up over time.  Lump sum investing is many times not available for the vast majority of normies, and sure of course, if you have some abilities to lump sum invest there is nothing wrong with exercising such option because having a lump sum gives you options to invest it all at once or to even engage in some kind of DCA approach with investing the lump sum over time rather than all at once.  Buying on dips is not a bad idea, but it requires timing the market.

comments.author: Sim_card
comments.body: I hope that you are not in a urge to buy bitcoin because the price is increasing and you think that you can make quick profit from it by selling when the price has gone higher than the amount you bought it. If you are having this idea running in your head then I will advise you not to buy bitcoin because bitcoin is not a get rich quick scheme.      On the other hand, if you are buying bitcoin because you are seeing bitcoin as an asset or a store of value or because your country currency is depreciating and you want to use bitcoin as an hedge to inflation...good. First of all, you should have it in mind that bitcoin is a long term investment because that is the only way that you can lessen the risk in bitcoin if you are on a long term investment. After that you should prepare yourself and plan on how much that you will use to buy bitcoin every week or monthly that wouldn't affect your monthly expenses. You should have an emergency funds available that will enable you take care of any emergency during your accumulating period. DCA regularly will help you to increase your bitcoin size and you have to set a goal on your bitcoin target so that this can enable you to be focused. You can invest for 4-10yrs and above. During investing, you can start learning the area that you will love to know more. Don't keep your bitcoin in an exchange but keep them in a non-custodial wallet.
